SAM.description_of_public: The serviceable available market is focused on university and high-school students in the EU, who represent a significant portion of the TAM due to lifestyle choices and sustainability focus.
SAM.justification: SAM is estimated as 40% of TAM, reflecting the realistic market size that can be captured within the student segment in the EU. This is based on the number of universities and high schools in the region, as well as the increasing trend towards sustainable living among young adults. Assumptions include the growth of sustainability initiatives and student engagement with eco-friendly products.

SOM.description_of_public: The serviceable obtainable market represents the segment of the SAM that can be realistically captured by BMW EcoHydrate within the first few years of launching the product.
SOM.justification: SOM is estimated at approximately 10% of SAM in the first two years, growing to about 20% by year 5. This accounts for initial brand recognition, marketing efforts, and partnerships with universities. Assumptions include effective marketing strategies and the establishment of a strong brand presence in the lifestyle sector, driving adoption among students.
